result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: WCSO advised defendant has not complied with booking; defendant contacted to notify the defendant to comply with booking

Defendant is incarcerated in Fond du Lac County Jail with a release date of 10-21-2022.  10-19-2022 Plea hearing rescheduled to 11-16-2022 at 8:15 a.m. to allow defendant to appear in person.  Defendant to comply with booking requirements at Washington County Jail.
WCSO advised defendant has not complied with booking; defendant contacted to notify the defendant to comply with booking

Attorney Mark David Bensen in court for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears via audio.  Defendant states she did not have a ride to court today and is currently on electronic bracelet supervision in Dodge County.  Defendant will be able to obtain her occupational after mid-September.  Defendant continues to waive counsel.  Adjourned to allow defendant to obtain her license.  Court directs defendant to be in person for the next court hearing.  Defendant will hold pretrial today with District Attorney Bensen after court session is done.  If agreement is reached and stipulation is filed, then defendant will not be required to appear. Defendant has not completed booking process at Washington County Sheriff's Dept.  Court directs defendant to complete booking process.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Plea hearing on October 19, 2022 at 09:45 am.
WCSO advised defendant has not complied with booking; defendant contacted to notify the defendant to comply with booking

Clerk BMC; Prosecuting attorney Stephanie L Hanson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sarah J Bentz in court. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Not guilty plea entered by Court. Def will represent self for the time being. Court accepts waiver of counsel. State does not object to signature bond. Court orders $500 signature bond.
Hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on July 26, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
